author: pandupewe
body: INTU is smoll and neglected but looks solid

author: zillabunnny
body:
I got cucked for an average cost-basis of 20.54 but also plan on holding at least through the first earnings or two.

Rocket's product lineup is appealing to the newer generation of lendees who demand frictionless experiences. I see similarities to Turbotax(INTU), Carvana, Wayfair, and any number of direct to consumer businesses that have exploded in recent history. 

While the pace of originations will slow with the expected rising of rates in the near future-- it should be noted that 75% of originations in the first quarter were first-time home buyers and that RKT has a client retention of \~75%. I think it's fair to assume they'll see growth in their other product lineups based upon the large amount of exposure they're getting with refi's and a booming home buying market right now.

author: Signal_Teaching4646
body:
Hi all. I’m new to this forum and was hopping you could help me rebalance my portfolio. I started investing at the beginning of last year and have about a little over 30k in my account. However, I am trailing the s&p500 and nasdaq (quite considerably) for the period and would like to get some advice on what would be the best approach for “catching up” to the market. Currently my portfolio is GOOGL 18%, FB 14%, V 10%, MU 9%, INTC 8%, OXY 8%, BA 7%, WFC 5%, INTU 4%, KEYS 4%, FLT 4%, UBER 3%, JNJ 3%, GILD 3%, MCD 2%.

Given the holdings above, where do you recommend I reduce/add or exit positions? I am considering selling the portfolio entirely and buying a few index funds instead to avoid the hassle of trying to beat the market, which I’m clearly not good at lol.

Any feedback appreciated. Thanks

author: peon2
body:
On the one hand I agree, fuck companies like Exxon lobbying to stop climate change action. Fuck H&R Block and Intuit for lobbying to keep tax codes complicated. Fuck X Company for lobbying for Y.

But really when it comes down to it, these companies are trying to maximize profit and sustain their business models. They have no obligation to do the "right" thing.

It's the politicians that ACCEPT the bribes and ALLOW lobbying to work who are the assholes that are selling us down the drain. An oil company has no reason to try and help society, that's 100% of what a politician's job is supposed to do.

author: Smooothoperat0r
body: What's the thesis on INTU in the future? I just can't understand buying the stock. I'm not downing it or you, I just don't understand. Would you share with me? I've been seeing this name for 2 years and thought: "I just don't get the long term growth."

author: dwdsquared2
body:
Sorry, apparently the Germany DAX is close to a c r y p t 0 ticker and it blocked my post then my second post for saying  c r y p t 0 

**Events in the US Today (EDT):**

* 8:55am - Redbook (MoM&YoY) \[1/3 Volatility\]
* 9:00am - House Price Index (MoM&YoY-Jun) \[1/3 Volatility\]
   * S&P/CS HPI Composite (MoM&YoY-Jun) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 10:00am - CB Consumer Confidence (Aug) \[3/3 Volatility\]
   * New Home Sales (Jul) \[3/3 Volatility\]
   * Richmond Manuf., Shipments, Services Index (Aug) \[1/3 Volatility\]
   * The House convenes for a pro forma session
* 1:00pm - 2-Year Note Auction \[1/3 Volatility\]
* 2:30pm - The Senate meets for a pro forma session. The full Senate is scheduled to meet on Sept. 8.
* 3:25pm - FOMC Member Daly Speaks \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 4:30pm - API Weekly Crude Oil Stock \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 10:30pm - POTUS attends the First Lady’s Remarks to the 2020 RNC
   * The Rose Garden
* **Fed Chairman Jerome Powell will speak Thursday during a virtual version of the Fed’s annual Jackson Hole, Wyoming, conference.**
   * **Powell is set to deliver ‘profoundly consequential’ speech, changing how the Fed views inflation**
   * **He is expected to outline what could be the central bank’s most active efforts ever to spur inflation back to a healthy level.**
   * **“Average inflation” targeting means the Fed will allow inflation to run higher than normal for a period of time.**
   * **The effort will be the reverse of former Fed Chairman Paul Volcker’s rate hikes instituted to quash inflation in the 1980s.**
* In the biggest reshuffling in 7 years, Exxon Mobil, Pfizer and Raytheon Technologies were kicked out of the Dow Jones, making way for Salesforce, Amgen, and Honeywell to enter the 124-yr old equity gauge Aug 31st. The actions were prompted when Apple -- currently 12% of the 30-stock index -- announced a stock split that reduced the sway of computer and software companies in the price-weighted average.
* U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators held a phone call Tuesday morning Beijing time about implementing the phase one agreement between the two countries.
* The EPA approved use by American Airlines of a surface coating designed to fight COVID-19 for up to a week as a transmission risk through human contact in public spaces.
* The Miami Dolphins and the University of Miami’s football program announced on Monday plans to allow 13,000 spectators to attend the first games of the season in September.

**Events in the World Today (EDT):**

* 2:00am - Germany GDP (QoQ&YoY-Q2) \[3/3 Volatility\]
   * Norway GDP QoQ-Q2) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 2:30am - Switzerland Employment Level (Q2) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 4:00am - Germany Ifo Business Climate Index (Aug) \[3/3 Volatility\]
   * Germany Current Assessment (Aug) \[2/3 Volatility\]
   * Germany Business Expectations (Aug) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 1:30pm - Canada BoC Gov Council Member Schembri Speaks \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 6:45pm - New Zealand Trade Balance (MoM&YoY-Jul) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 9:30pm - Australia Construction Work Done (QoQ-Q2) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* Global markets got a boost as top U.S. and Chinese trade officials reaffirmed their commitment to the Phase 1 trade deal despite diplomatic rifts between the two countries.
* The trade-sensitive German DAX rose 0.6% after data showed Europe's largest economy contracted by a record 9.7% in the second quarter, but marked a minor upward revision from an earlier estimate of -10.1%.
* Hong Kong University on Monday reported the first apparent confirmed case of a patient who contracted COVID-19 twice, raising questions about the durability of antibodies and the immune response.

**Earnings Before Open:**

* Best Buy, Medtronic, Smucker's, Hormel Foods, Scotiabank, Bank of Montreal, The Children's Place, Autohome, Inc., Hain Celestial, Premier

**Earnings After Close:**

* Salesforce, Intuit, Autodesk, Toll Brothers, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Urban Outfitters, Nordstrom, Pure Storage, Heico, Scansource

author: putsonall
body:
Way to keep your head on straight. I had an experience like yours when I was younger. It gave me the thicker skin, and a better risk/reward gut. It’s something you can’t intuit your way to; you have to go through it.

You’ve now done that. Take this as your lesson and move forward, applying the lesson in all aspects of your life. You’ll be back.

The money you still have in abundance is time.

author: Sabotage00
body:
The stock DID shoot up, a WEEK or two maybe before earnings! 

ATVI is pretty much the only stock I make consistent gains on because I follow them and play all their stuff. The last two years, same pattern. 

But to your question of will it increase; look at their competitors. EA is a larger beast and it barely hit somewhere close to $119 before sinking back down to 90's. Do you think activision is in the same league as a company that produces consistent hits with sports titles and sims?

I'd say, almost! CoD was not a truly consistent blockbuster until recently. On the blizzard end, WoW was declining until corona hit and everyone needed something to do/ a dopamine hit. Blizzard is taking it's sweet time with new titles, and Activision was locked out of china until now. 

So, if I were to intuit based on patterns and this with terrible math skills and rudimentary stock knowledge, I'd say around $80 is fair to even optimistic based on expectations of new titles. 

That said, since the stock market is larger than one company, political concerns and FED pump will distort that number. It could hit 90 as more people throw money into gaming stocks in general, but it's typically not a very volatile stock
